tweets.html:
What if 'The Celebrity Apprentice' starred real celebrities? George Clooney vs. Matt Damon for who can sell more churros in Central Park.

— Evan Kirby (@evankirby) January 4, 2012

Reporters' fascination with @rupertmurdoch joining Twitter a bit like a boy watching his grandfather attempt to rap

— Steven Zeitchik (@ZeitchikWaPo) January 4, 2012

I always think I remember how horrifying The Bachelor is, and then a new season comes along and someone raps. And I realize I forgot.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) January 4, 2012

Sometimes I pretend my life is a sitcom. So if you see me smile and wave to nobody, we're just at the opening credits.

— Brent Piaskoski (@BrentPiaskoski) January 4, 2012

Nissan must be targeting the "Doesn't care about physical impossibilities" market. Every time a truck does a barrel roll, an engineer dies.

— Andrew Seroff (@Aseroff) January 4, 2012

Fair warning (again): Next two weeks = Television Critics Association press tour. Which means tweetplosion of epic proportions. Noted.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) January 4, 2012

Every time there's a mention of "Downton Abbey" you can hear frantic typing.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) January 4, 2012

Federal support of PBS equates to $1.35 per person, Kerger says. Notes it won't really buy a cup of coffee. #NotInLaForSure

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) January 4, 2012

Nobody at PBS thinks I love PBS, but I do. Just worried that if England collapses, so does PBS. Or if Ken Burns gets hit by a bus.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) January 4, 2012

I really like Charlie Rose's show, but worried the production values are too costly and will cripple PBS. #pbsjoke. #productionvaluejoke.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) January 4, 2012

If Ty Treadway is on #OLTL all week and doesn't take off his shirt at least once, it's a wasted opportunity.

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) January 4, 2012

Can't wait for PBS to announce its first animated movie, "An American Entail." #DowntonAbbey

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) January 4, 2012

Dear Twitter/World, your chosen acronym for ABC's Once Upon a Time looks vaguely vulgar and makes the show even less appealing. Sry.

— Michael O'Connell (@mikeylikestv) January 4, 2012

Good luck with "Mobbed," Fox. Glad to see you're taking a chance on fresh, edgy and original talent like Howie Mandel.

— UPN (@upntweets) January 4, 2012

The first act of Monday's HIMYM felt like it took an hour.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) January 4, 2012

Theory: airports made 24 hour news channels possible.

— Mark Sample (@samplereality) January 5, 2012

At this point it's a bigger story if Keith Olbermann isn't clashing with his bosses.

— Steven Zeitchik (@ZeitchikWaPo) January 5, 2012

If one find Extreme Couponing aspirational, does that mean the end is near?

— Blerg (@MediaObsessed) January 5, 2012

Whoa, just saw a live episode of Modern Family on the street in front of my apartment! Or coulda been an ordinary car accident. Hard to tell

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) January 5, 2012

The 6.1 mil who saw the "Work It" premiere can never unsee it.

— Matthew Gilbert (@MatthewGilbert) January 4, 2012

ABC just promo'd #WorkIt as "the new hit comedy." i think they dropped the "s" in the third word

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) January 5, 2012

I feel like live-tweeting some bad television. Hmmm, if only something really awful aired this week...

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) January 5, 2012

This show has literally no faith in its viewers. No subtlety, no clever writing - and I haven't even reached the cross-dressing. #WorkIt

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) January 5, 2012

Oh God there it is. Jesus Christ. #WorkIt

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) January 5, 2012

This. Is. Remarkable. I have never seen a a show so blisteringly ignorant, so wretchedly unfunny in its cringe comedy. #WorkIt

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) January 5, 2012

Rule Number 1, if I ran #DowntonAbbey: NO OPENING OF MAIL DURING BREAKFAST. THE LETTERS ARE ALWAYS BAD!

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) January 5, 2012

The reason we need Community to come back, w Parks&Rec, Modern Family, Happy Endings, is to balance the TV darkness of Criminal Minds, SVU

— Ellen O'Neill (@MaPeel) January 5, 2012

Benedict Cumberbatch for "Star Trek"? Whee! Tomorrow's #TCA12 "Sherlock" panel just got a lot more off-topic-y.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) January 5, 2012

OMG BENEDICT CUMBERBATCH IS GONNA BE IN STAR TREK 2 BENEDICT CUMBERBATCH IS GOING TO BE IN STAR TREK 2. OMG OMG. #everyfangirlthought

— FLAMES ON (@thesideofmyface) January 5, 2012

I just did a Kermit flail. IRL. RT @StaxIGN: Benedict Cumberbatch Cast as Villain in JJ Abrams' Star Trek Sequel http://t.co/FSWEuH4C

— Kate Noble/Kate Rorick (@NobleRorick) January 5, 2012

The asset of starting from a lousy premise: A steady source of self-deprecating jokes to kick around once you grow out of it. #HappyEndings

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) January 5, 2012

Every ep of #HappyEndings has all the comedy food groups: slapstick, wordplay, character, one-liners, parody, sexy, dancing, & guest star.

— inessentials (@inessentials) January 5, 2012

I seriously wish there was an actual Rom Com Con. "Katherine Heigl's panel was incredible. Here's the chain? Off it." #happyendings

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) January 5, 2012

Wrestling costumes and rehearsals. Brad's return is epic! #themiddle

— DuckyDoesTv (@DuckyDoesTV) January 5, 2012

I liked tonight's Modern Family, but they need to stop making Mitch and Cam play out old I Love Lucy plots.

— Jeverett15 (@jeverett15) January 5, 2012

If I had the talent to write a song, I'd pen an ode to Sue Heck. #themiddle

— Chris Becker (@crsbecker) January 5, 2012

Last night's #TheMiddle was one of the series' best. Hit each character note just right, superb performances, great lines.

— inessentials (@inessentials) January 5, 2012

Tyler is one basket short of a picnic. #Revenge

— Jillian (@jillianbowe) January 5, 2012

I want Victoria to adopt me. #Revenge

— Jillian (@jillianbowe) January 5, 2012

Madeleine Stowe looks outstanding in that dress. Truly, she must bathe in virgin blood. #Revenge

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) January 5, 2012

REVENGEEEEEEEEEEEEE!
I know I'm late, but I like to be able to fast forward through all the commercials, that is my revenge.

— BurnThemAll (@aboleyn) January 5, 2012

Tonight's #Revenge is ridiculously soapy. I love it.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) January 5, 2012

damn, Tyler is way sexier when he's being crazy. #Revenge

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) January 5, 2012

Declan. Go play in traffic. #Revenge

— Jillian (@jillianbowe) January 5, 2012

tweets.author_name: cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future
tweets.html:
Holy fucking SHIT! What's going ON in this episode?! #REVENGE

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) January 5, 2012

My mom loves #Revenge, which probably means it's the worst goddamn show of all time.

— Evan Kirby (@evankirby) January 5, 2012

this is JUST like my last birthday party. so awkward. #Revenge

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) January 5, 2012

If you dig Emily Thorne's emo cover of "Nothing Else Matters," just wait til you hear Victoria's rendition of "Master of Puppets." #REVENGE

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) January 5, 2012

Why does #Revenge have to end each week? So damn delicious.

— DuckyDoesTv (@DuckyDoesTV) January 5, 2012

Watched #Revenge for the first time tonight and have come to the conclusion that Ashton Holmes is the greatest actor of all time.

— Evan Kirby (@evankirby) January 5, 2012

So, Twitter, I feel as though we need to discuss Ashton Holmes campin' the hell out of tonight's #Revenge. It was wonderfully absurd.

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) January 5, 2012

When I am wealthy the first thing I'm doing is installing cable in my bathroom. I'd love nothing more than to watch ABC's lineup in the tub.

— Danielle Turchiano (@danielletbd) January 5, 2012

"grey's anatomy returns tomorrow night..." is that a threat, ABC?

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) January 5, 2012

I just now stopped being nauseous from that shot of Jenny McCarthy kissing the cop on New Years Rockin Eve

— Justin Stangel (@Justin_Stangel) January 5, 2012

dear #TopChef, please make Chris Jones get rid of that Pebbles ponytail or I WILL

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) January 5, 2012

Prilosec sponsors #TopChef Texas. I think I speak for everyone when I say: "Bahahahahahahahahaha."

— Yule Brenna (@brennawilliams) January 5, 2012

Absolutely everything about this show is shit. #90210

— tv observatory (@tvobservatory) January 5, 2012

Maybe the worst show on television. That I can't stop watching. RT @tvobservatory Absolutely everything about this show is shit. #90210

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) January 5, 2012

Thank you to the press for being so gracious about being spoiler-free for TVD "The New Deal." Cuz HOLY SH*T is there a BFD scene in it.

— Julie Plec (@julieplec) January 5, 2012

I have to go to bed, less then 20 hours until an all new #TVD and I need to look my best for Damon.

— BurnThemAll (@aboleyn) January 5, 2012

When watching #Parenthood with me, you can be damn sure that I'll bust out my horrible Bob Dylan impression when the theme song kicks in.

— Evan Kirby (@evankirby) January 5, 2012

@TVandDinners I'd watch a show that's just Coach and Mrs. Taylor talking to each other abt meeting dysfunctional TV chars from other shows.

— Devan Joneson (@djoneson) January 5, 2012

I would very much like to see Kalinda Sharma vs. Lisbeth Salander in the battle of the investigators.

— Evan Kirby (@evankirby) January 5, 2012

Please God let this happen. -H RT @kanyewest: I was just discussing becoming the creative director for the Jetson movie

— Heather & Jessica (@fuggirls) January 5, 2012

How long til there's a TV show pitch based on tonight's rambling Kanye tweets?

— Diane Gordon (@thesurfreport) January 5, 2012

@AlyssaRosenberg I think Kanye heard you were missing article ideas or something tonight.

— Rowan Kaiser (@RowanKaiser) January 5, 2012

Is "ShitMyKanyeSays" taken as a Twitter handle yet? If not I'm all over that.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) January 5, 2012

Newest theory: Kanye West saw #WorkIt, and it was like The Master staring into the Time Vortex. #DoctorWho

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) January 5, 2012

Kayne West and Kevin Kline announce plans for the new film "A Fish Called DONDA."

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) January 5, 2012
